Comment: I believe the name 'Mahesh' may refer to someone from the subcontinent, but I did not check.  I had been playing a lot of hasty chess, and I hadn't been showing them any class.  I enjoyed this game because I was able to get a small advantage and increase it, without slipping up, as I showed the squares some class.
I know this move looks passive, and I have criticized it before, but since I don't like to play with fianchettoed bishops I often use the dark-squared bishop in a defensive role.

The semi-slav.  Since I often play it as black, I remember many ways white can make it uncomfortable.
All the moves were standard until this Qa5.  I consider it quite a poor move given black's lack of development.  Maybe white is continually better after this absurd Qa5.

So I am getting trading off the dark-squared bishop.  I had received some criticism in an earlier annotation after I referred to a bishop as "bad".  Here, even though it could occupy a useful role defensively, it is bad in comparison to black's more active bishop.
